sn16.4:4.2: What do you think, mendicants? What kind of mendicant is worthy of visiting families? And what kind of mendicant is not worthy of visiting families?”
sn16.4:4.3: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn16.4:5.2: ‘May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
sn16.4:5.3: May they give a lot, not a little.
sn16.4:5.4: May they give me fine things, not coarse.
sn16.4:5.5: May they give quickly, not slowly.
sn16.4:5.6: May they give carefully, not carelessly.’
sn16.4:5.7: If a mendicant with such a thought approaches a family and they don’t give, the mendicant feels slighted.
sn16.4:5.8: And they experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:5.9: If they give only a little …
sn16.4:5.15: And they experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:5.16: That kind of mendicant is not worthy of visiting families.
sn16.4:6.1: Whoever visits families with the thought:
sn16.4:6.2: ‘When among other families, how could I possibly think:
sn16.4:6.3: “May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
sn16.4:6.4: May they give a lot, not a little.
sn16.4:6.5: May they give me fine things, not coarse.
sn16.4:6.6: May they give quickly, not slowly.
sn16.4:6.7: May they give carefully, not carelessly.”’
sn16.4:6.8: If a mendicant with such a thought approaches a family and they don’t give,
sn16.4:6.10: And they don’t experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:6.11: If they give only a little …
sn16.4:6.22: And they don’t experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:6.23: That kind of mendicant is worthy of visiting families.
sn16.4:7.1: Kassapa visits families with the thought:
sn16.4:7.2: ‘When among other families, how could I possibly think:
sn16.4:7.3: “May they give to me, may they not fail to give.
sn16.4:7.4: May they give a lot, not a little.
sn16.4:7.5: May they give me fine things, not coarse.
sn16.4:7.6: May they give quickly, not slowly.
sn16.4:7.7: May they give carefully, not carelessly.”’
sn16.4:7.8: With such a thought, if he approaches a family and they don’t give,
sn16.4:7.10: And he doesn’t experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:7.11: If they give only a little …
sn16.4:7.22: And he doesn’t experience pain and sadness because of that.
sn16.4:7.23: I will exhort you with the example of Kassapa or someone like him. You should practice accordingly.”
